gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours
Class Contours

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.Contours
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState
Direct Known Subclasses:
MixedContours, NonUniformContours, UniformContours
public abstract class Contours
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPreserveState

Encapsulates the basic information needed to use a set of contour lines needed to generate a contour plot of some data.

Field Detail

NUM_LEVELS_KEY

public static final java.lang.String NUM_LEVELS_KEY
"Number of levels" - This static constant String is a key for referencing the number of contour levels stored in this collection of contour levels. The value that this key references is an Integer object.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_NUM_LEVELS

public static final int DEFAULT_NUM_LEVELS
The default number of contour levels for a collection of contour levels. The value of this field is 2. The value is 2 because a collection of uniformly spaced contour levels would expect to have at least 2 contour levels.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Contours

public Contours(int numLevels)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a Contours object that corresponds to a set of numLevels contour lines.

Parameters:
numLevels - The number of levels in a given set of data at which contour lines should be drawn.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If and only if numLevels<=0
See Also:
getLevelAt(int)
Method Detail

getNumLevels

public int getNumLevels()
Used to determine the number of contours lines that this set of contour lines contains.

Returns:
The number of levels in a given set of data at which countour lines should be drawn.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Used to get a readout describing the contours levels encapsulated by this Contours object. The readout returned is designed for debugging purposes.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A String describing this Contours object.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
Used to get the state information for this Contours object. Because this class describes the abstract information needed to describe a set of contour levels, the only piece of information saved in the state is the number of contour levels. Subclasses need to override this method to include more specific state information.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Parameters:
isDefault - If true the default state for this Contours object is returned. If false the current state is returned.
Returns:
This Contours object's state.

setObjectState

public void setObjectState(ObjectState state)
Used to set the state information for this Contours object. The only information that is saved in the state is the number of contour levels in this collection of contour levels.

Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Parameters:
state - An encapsulation of the state information for this Contours object.

getLevelAt

public abstract float getLevelAt(int i)
Get the value of the ith contour level. If you think of contour plot of a given set of data as if it were a topological map, this method would return the elevation on the ith contour line.

Parameters:
i - The index referencing the contour line to analyze. These indexes should be used in exactly the same way that array indexes are used. For example, if getNumLevels() returns 4, then indexes 0, 1, 2, and 3 can be used to reference the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th contour level respectively. Note: It is the responsibility of subclasses to ensure that this behavior is maintained.
Returns:
The "elevation" of the ith contour level.

getLowestLevel

public abstract float getLowestLevel()
Get the "elevation" of the lowest contour level.

Returns:
The value of the lowest contour level.

getHighestLevel

public abstract float getHighestLevel()
Get the "elevation" of the highest contour level.

Returns:
The value of the highest contour level.
